parameters.name: name
parameters.description:
name is unique ID of a resource along with (partnerID, organizationID,
projectID)

parameters.name: selector
parameters.description: selector is used to filter the labels of a resource

parameters.name: displayName
parameters.description: displayName only used for update queries to set displayName (READONLY)

parameters.name: labels
parameters.description:
labels only used for update queries to set labels (READONLY)

This is a request variable of the map type. The query format is "map_name[key]=value", e.g. If the map name is Age, the key type is string, and the value type is integer, the query parameter is expressed as Age["bob"]=18

parameters.name: annotations
parameters.description:
annotations only used for update queries to set annotations (READONLY)

This is a request variable of the map type. The query format is "map_name[key]=value", e.g. If the map name is Age, the key type is string, and the value type is integer, the query parameter is expressed as Age["bob"]=18

parameters.name: ignoreScopeDefault
parameters.description:
ignoreScopeDefault ignores default values for partnerID, organizationID and
projectID

parameters.name: urlScope
parameters.description: urlScope is supposed to be passed in the URL as kind/HashID(value)

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: generic way to specify a type of resource, mainly for use in users endpoint

lastUpdated.description: when the condition status is last updated
lastUpdated.title: Last Updated

reason.description: reason of the last condition status
reason.title: Reason

status.description: Status of the condition, one of True, False, Unknown.

lastHeartbeatTime.title:
Last time we got an update on a given condition.
+optional

lastTransitionTime.title:
Last time the condition transit from one status to another.
+optional

reason.title:
(brief) reason for the condition's last transition.
+optional

message.title:
Human readable message indicating details about last transition.
+optional

v1NodeCondition.description: NodeCondition contains condition information for a node.

machineID.title:
MachineID reported by the node. For unique machine identification
in the cluster this field is preferred. Learn more from man(5)
machine-id: http://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man5/machine-id.5.html

systemUUID.title:
SystemUUID reported by the node. For unique machine identification
MachineID is preferred. This field is specific to Red Hat hosts
https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_subscription_management/1/html/rhsm/uuid

bootID.description: Boot ID reported by the node.

kernelVersion.description: Kernel Version reported by the node from 'uname -r' (e.g. 3.16.0-0.bpo.4-amd64).

osImage.description: OS Image reported by the node from /etc/os-release (e.g. Debian GNU/Linux 7 (wheezy)).

containerRuntimeVersion.description: ContainerRuntime Version reported by the node through runtime remote API (e.g. docker://1.5.0).

kubeletVersion.description: Kubelet Version reported by the node.

kubeProxyVersion.description: KubeProxy Version reported by the node.

operatingSystem.title: The Operating System reported by the node

architecture.title: The Architecture reported by the node

v1NodeSystemInfo.description: NodeSystemInfo is a set of ids/uuids to uniquely identify the node.

key.description: Required. The taint key to be applied to a node.

value.title:
The taint value corresponding to the taint key.
+optional

effect.description:
Required. The effect of the taint on pods
that do not tolerate the taint.
Valid effects are NoSchedule, PreferNoSchedule and NoExecute.

timeAdded.title:
TimeAdded represents the time at which the taint was added.
It is only written for NoExecute taints.
+optional

v1Taint.description:
The node this Taint is attached to has the "effect" on
any pod that does not tolerate the Taint.

seconds.description:
Represents seconds of UTC time since Unix epoch
1970-01-01T00:00:00Z. Must be from 0001-01-01T00:00:00Z to
9999-12-31T23:59:59Z inclusive.

nanos.description:
Non-negative fractions of a second at nanosecond resolution. Negative
second values with fractions must still have non-negative nanos values
that count forward in time. Must be from 0 to 999,999,999
inclusive. This field may be limited in precision depending on context.

v1Time.description:
Time is a wrapper around time.Time which supports correct
marshaling to YAML and JSON.  Wrappers are provided for many
of the factory methods that the time package offers.

+protobuf.options.marshal=false
+protobuf.as=Timestamp
+protobuf.options.(gogoproto.goproto_stringer)=false

apiVersion.description: API Version of the list resource
apiVersion.title: API Version

clusterType.description: Type of the cluster being created
clusterType.title: Cluster Type

v3ConditionStatus.title:
$title: ConditionStatus
$description: status of a condition for a resource

contentType.description: The HTTP Content-Type header value specifying the content type of the body.

data.description: The HTTP request/response body as raw binary.

v3HttpBody.title:
HttpBody represents arbitrary HTTP Body. It should only be used for
payload formats that can't be represented as JSON

v3ListMetadata.title:
$title: ListMetadata
$description: metadata for a list of resources
$required: enabled

organization.description: Organization to which the resource belongs
organization.title: Organization

partner.description: Partner to which the resource belongs
partner.title: Partner

v3ParalusConditionStatus.title: ParalusConditionStatus is the status of the status condition

projectID.description: Project ID associated with the cluster
